<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(1)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Historical
	production relates to the amount of metal sales, subject to our stream and royalty interests for each fiscal year presented, as
	reported to us by the operators of the mines, and may differ from stream deliveries discussed in Item&nbsp;2, Properties, or from the operators' public reporting.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(2)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Royalty
	no longer considered principal to our business as of June&nbsp;30, 2016.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Critical Accounting Policies
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Listed below are the accounting policies that the Company believes are critical to its financial statements due to the degree of
	uncertainty regarding the estimates or assumptions involved and the magnitude of the asset, liability, revenue or expense being reported. Please refer to Note&nbsp;2 of the notes to consolidated
	financial statements for a discussion on recently issued accounting pronouncements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Use of Estimates
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The preparation of our financial statements, in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of
	America, requires management to make estimates and assumptions. These estimates and assumptions affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities, at the date of the financial statements, as well
	as the reported amounts of revenues and expenses during the reporting period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	41
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=43,EFW="2229433",CP="ROYAL GOLD, INC",DN="1",CHK=295205,FOLIO='41',FILE='DISK127:[16ZBQ1.16ZBQ74901]DO74901A.;15',USER='CMATTI',CD=';9-AUG-2016;17:42' -->
<A NAME="A2229433Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DO74901_1_42">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229433Z10-K_HTM_BG74901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	most critical accounting estimates relate to our assumptions regarding future gold, silver, copper, nickel and other metal prices and the estimates of reserves, production and
	recoveries of third-party mine operators. We rely on reserve estimates reported by the operators on the properties in which we have stream and royalty interests. These estimates and the underlying
	assumptions affect the potential
	impairments of long-lived assets and the ability to realize income tax benefits associated with deferred tax assets. These estimates and assumptions also affect the rate at which we recognize revenue
	or charge depreciation, depletion and amortization to earnings. On an ongoing basis, management evaluates these estimates and assumptions; however, actual amounts could differ from these estimates and
	assumptions. Differences between estimates and actual amounts are adjusted and recorded in the period that the actual amounts are known.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Stream and Royalty Interests
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Stream and royalty interests include acquired stream and royalty interests in production, development and exploration stage properties.
	The costs of acquired stream and royalty interests are capitalized as tangible assets as such interests do not meet the definition of a financial asset under the Accounting Standards Codification
	("ASC") guidance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Acquisition
	costs of production stage stream and royalty interests are depleted using the units of production method over the life of the mineral property (as sales occur under stream
	interests or royalty payments are recognized), which are estimated using proven and probable reserves as provided by the operator. Acquisition costs of stream and royalty interests on development
	stage mineral properties, which are not yet in production, are not amortized until the property begins production. Acquisition costs of stream or royalty interests on exploration stage mineral
	properties, where there are no proven and probable reserves, are not amortized. At such time as the associated exploration stage mineral interests are converted to proven and probable reserves, the
	cost basis is amortized over the remaining life of the mineral property, using proven and probable reserves. Exploration costs are expensed when incurred.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Asset Impairment
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We evaluate long-lived assets for impairment whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that the related carrying amounts of
	an asset or group of assets may not be recoverable. The recoverability of the carrying value of stream and royalty interests in production and development stage mineral properties is evaluated based
	upon estimated future undiscounted net cash flows from each stream and royalty interest using estimates of proven and probable reserves and other relevant information received from the operators. We
	evaluate the recoverability of the carrying value of royalty interests in exploration stage mineral properties in the event of significant decreases in the price of gold, silver, copper and other
	metals, and whenever new information regarding the mineral properties is obtained from the operator indicating that production will not likely occur or may be reduced in the future, thus potentially
	affecting the future recoverability of our stream or royalty interests. Impairments in the carrying value of each property are measured and recorded to the extent
	that the carrying value in each property exceeds its estimated fair value, which is generally calculated using estimated future discounted cash flows.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Estimates
	of gold, silver, copper, nickel and other metal prices, operators' estimates of proven and probable reserves or mineralized material related to our stream or royalty
	properties, and operators' estimates of operating and capital costs are subject to certain risks and uncertainties which may affect the recoverability of our investment in these stream and royalty
	interests in mineral properties. It is possible that changes could occur to these estimates, which could adversely affect the net cash flows expected to be generated from these stream and royalty
	interests. Refer to Note&nbsp;4 of the notes to consolidated financial statements for discussion and the results of our impairment assessments for the fiscal years ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 and
	2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	42
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=44,EFW="2229433",CP="ROYAL GOLD, INC",DN="1",CHK=741798,FOLIO='42',FILE='DISK127:[16ZBQ1.16ZBQ74901]DO74901A.;15',USER='CMATTI',CD=';9-AUG-2016;17:42' -->
<A NAME="A2229433Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DO74901_1_43">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229433Z10-K_HTM_BG74901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Revenue
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Revenue is recognized pursuant to guidance in ASC 605 and based upon amounts contractually due pursuant to the underlying streaming or
	royalty agreement. Specifically, revenue is recognized in accordance with the terms of the underlying stream or royalty agreements subject to (i)&nbsp;the pervasive evidence of the existence of the
	arrangements; (ii)&nbsp;the risks and rewards having been transferred; (iii)&nbsp;the stream or royalty being fixed or determinable; and (iv)&nbsp;the collectability being reasonably assured.
	For our streaming agreements, we recognize revenue when the metal is sold.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Metal Sales
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Gold and silver received under our metal streaming agreements is taken into inventory and then is sold primarily using average spot
	rate gold and silver forward contracts. The sales price for our gold and silver sold in average spot rate forward contracts is determined by the average daily gold or silver spot prices under the term
	of the contract, typically over a consecutive number of trading days between 10&nbsp;days and three months (depending on the frequency of deliveries under the respective streaming agreement and our
	sales policy in effect at the time) commencing shortly after receipt and purchase of the metal. Revenue from gold and silver sales is recognized on the date of the settlement, which is also the date
	that title to the gold or silver passes to the purchaser.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Cost of Sales
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Cost of sales is specific to our stream agreements and is the result of our purchase of gold and silver for a cash payment. The cash
	payment at Mount Milligan is the lesser of $435 per ounce or the prevailing market price of gold when purchased, while the cash payment for our other streams is a set contractual percentage of the
	gold or silver spot price near the date of metal delivery.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Exploration Costs
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Exploration costs are specific to our Peak Gold joint venture for exploration and advancement of the Tetlin gold project, as discussed
	further in Note&nbsp;3 of our notes to consolidated financial statements. Exploration costs associated with Peak Gold's exploration and advancement of the Tetlin gold project are expensed when
	incurred.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Income Taxes
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company accounts for income taxes in accordance with the guidance of ASC 740. The Company's annual tax rate is based on income,
	statutory tax rates in effect and tax planning opportunities available to us in the various jurisdictions in which the Company operates. Significant judgment is required in determining the annual tax
	expense, current tax assets and liabilities, deferred tax assets and liabilities, and our future taxable income, both as a whole and in various tax jurisdictions, for purposes of assessing our ability
	to realize future benefit from our deferred tax assets. Actual income taxes could vary from these estimates due to future changes in income tax law, significant changes in the jurisdictions in which
	we operate or unpredicted results from the final determination of each year's liability by taxing authorities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company's deferred income taxes reflect the impact of temporary differences between the reported amounts of assets and liabilities for financial reporting purposes and such amounts
	measured by tax laws and regulations. In evaluating the realizability of the deferred tax assets, management considers both positive and negative evidence that may exist, such as earnings history,
	reversal of taxable temporary differences, forecasted operating earnings and available tax planning strategies in each tax
	jurisdiction. A valuation allowance may be established to reduce our deferred tax assets to the amount that is considered more likely than not to be realized through the generation of future taxable
	income and other tax planning strategies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	43
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=45,EFW="2229433",CP="ROYAL GOLD, INC",DN="1",CHK=602737,FOLIO='43',FILE='DISK127:[16ZBQ1.16ZBQ74901]DO74901A.;15',USER='CMATTI',CD=';9-AUG-2016;17:42' -->
<A NAME="A2229433Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DO74901_1_44">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229433Z10-K_HTM_BG74901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company has asserted the indefinite reinvestment of certain foreign subsidiary earnings as determined by management's judgment about and intentions concerning the future operations
	of the Company. As a result, the Company does not record a U.S. deferred tax liability for the excess of the book basis over the tax basis of its investments in foreign corporations to the extent that
	the basis difference results from earnings that meet the indefinite reversal criteria. Refer to Note&nbsp;11 for further discussion on our assertion.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company's operations may involve dealing with uncertainties and judgments in the application of complex tax regulations in multiple jurisdictions. The final taxes paid are dependent
	upon many factors, including negotiations with taxing authorities in various jurisdictions and resolution of disputes arising from federal, state, and international tax audits. The Company recognizes
	potential liabilities and records tax liabilities for anticipated tax audit issues in the United States and other tax jurisdictions based on its estimate of whether, and the extent to which,
	additional taxes will be due. The Company adjusts these reserves in light of changing facts and circumstances, such as the progress of a tax audit; however, due to the complexity of some of these
	uncertainties, the ultimate resolution could result in a payment that is materially different from our current estimate of the tax liabilities. These differences will be reflected as increases or
	decreases to income tax expense in the period which they are determined. The Company recognizes interest and penalties, if any, related to unrecognized tax benefits in income tax expense.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL>
<A NAME="FIS_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Liquidity and Capital Resources
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Overview
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At June&nbsp;30, 2016, we had current assets of $164.8&nbsp;million compared to current liabilities of $22.7&nbsp;million
	resulting in a working capital surplus of $142.1&nbsp;million and a current ratio of 7 to 1. This compares to current assets of $797.0&nbsp;million and current liabilities of $25.0&nbsp;million
	at June&nbsp;30, 2015, resulting in a working capital surplus of $772.0&nbsp;million and a current ratio of approximately 32 to 1. The decrease in our working capital was primarily attributable to
	a decrease in our cash and equivalents as a result of the recent stream acquisitions, as discussed earlier under Item&nbsp;1, Business, Fiscal 2016 Business Developments. Please refer to "Summary of
	Cash Flows" below for further discussion on changes to our cash and equivalents during the period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
	the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, liquidity needs were met from $288.8&nbsp;million in net revenue and our available cash resources. As of June&nbsp;30, 2016, the
	Company had $375&nbsp;million available and $275&nbsp;million outstanding under its revolving credit facility. Working capital, combined with the Company's undrawn revolving credit facility,
	resulted in $517.1&nbsp;million of total liquidity at June&nbsp;30, 2016. The Company was in compliance with each financial covenant under its revolving credit facility as of June&nbsp;30, 2016.
	Refer to Note&nbsp;6 of our notes to consolidated financial statements and below ("Recent Liquidity and Capital Resource Developments") for further discussion on our debt.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	believe that our current financial resources and funds generated from operations will be adequate to cover anticipated expenditures for debt service, general and administrative
	expense costs and capital expenditures for the foreseeable future. Our current financial resources are also available to fund dividends and for acquisitions of stream and royalty interests, including
	the remaining conditional commitments incurred in connection with the Ilovica, Golden Star and Rainy River stream acquisitions and the Peak Gold joint venture. Our long-term capital requirements are
	primarily affected by our ongoing acquisition activities. The Company currently, and generally at any time, has acquisition opportunities in various stages of active review. In the event of one or
	more substantial stream and royalty interest or other acquisitions, we may seek additional debt or equity financing as necessary.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Please
	refer to our risk factors included in Part&nbsp;I, Item&nbsp;1A of this report for a discussion of certain risks that may impact the Company's liquidity and capital resources.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	44
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=46,EFW="2229433",CP="ROYAL GOLD, INC",DN="1",CHK=517254,FOLIO='44',FILE='DISK127:[16ZBQ1.16ZBQ74901]DO74901A.;15',USER='CMATTI',CD=';9-AUG-2016;17:42' -->
<A NAME="A2229433Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DO74901_1_45">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229433Z10-K_HTM_BG74901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Recent Liquidity and Capital Resource Developments
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Amendment to Revolving Credit Facility
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	March&nbsp;16, 2016, the Company entered into Amendment No.&nbsp;2 (the "Amendment") to the Sixth Amended and Restated Revolving Credit Agreement, dated
	as of January&nbsp;29, 2014 (as amended by Amendment No.&nbsp;1 thereto as of April&nbsp;29, 2015, the "Revolving Credit Agreement"), by and among the Company, certain subsidiaries of the
	Company as guarantors, certain lenders from time to time party thereto, and HSBC Bank USA, National Association, as administrative agent for the lenders. The Amendment revises the Revolving Credit
	Agreement to extend the scheduled maturity date from January&nbsp;29, 2019 to March&nbsp;16, 2021. As of June&nbsp;30, 2016, the Company had $275.0&nbsp;million outstanding under the Revolving
	Credit Agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Dividend Increase
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	November&nbsp;10, 2015, we announced an increase in our annual dividend for calendar 2016 from $0.88 to $0.92, payable on a quarterly basis of $0.23 per
	share. The newly declared dividend is 5% higher than the dividend paid during calendar 2015. Royal Gold has steadily increased its annual dividend since calendar 2001.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Summary of Cash Flows
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Operating Activities
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net
	cash provided by operating activities totaled $169.9&nbsp;million for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, compared to $192.1&nbsp;million for
	the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015. The decrease was primarily due to an increase in income taxes paid of approximately $55.8&nbsp;million primarily related to the sale of the Andacollo
	royalty, an increase in exploration costs of approximately $6.4&nbsp;million and an increase in interest paid of approximately $7.3&nbsp;million. These decreases in net cash provided by operating
	activities were partially offset by an increase in proceeds received from our stream and royalty interest interests, net of production taxes and cost of sales, of $47.5&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net
	cash provided by operating activities totaled $192.1&nbsp;million for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015, compared to $147.2&nbsp;million for the fiscal year ended
	June&nbsp;30, 2014. The increase was primarily due to an increase in proceeds received from our stream and royalty interests, net of production taxes and cost of sales, of approximately
	$31.2&nbsp;million. The increase was also due to a decrease in income tax payments, net of refunds, of approximately $7.1&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Investing Activities
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net
	cash used in investing activities totaled $1.0&nbsp;billion for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, compared to $51.2&nbsp;million for the
	fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015. The increase in cash used in investing activities is primarily due to an increase in acquisitions of stream and royalty interests in mineral properties
	(primarily the Pueblo Viejo and Andacollo stream acquisitions) compared to the prior year period. Please refer to Item&nbsp;1, Business, Fiscal 2016 Business Developments, for further discussion on
	our recently acquired streams.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net
	cash used in investing activities totaled $51.2&nbsp;million for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015, compared to $84.8&nbsp;million for the fiscal year ended
	June&nbsp;30, 2014. The decrease in cash used in investing activities was primarily due to a decrease in funding for stream or royalty acquisitions and the termination of the Tulsequah streaming
	agreement, resulting in the return of the original $10.0&nbsp;million advance payment. The Company made approximately $52.5&nbsp;million in commitment payments during the fiscal year ended
	June&nbsp;30, 2015, as part of the Phoenix Gold and Ilovica stream acquisitions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	45
</FONT>
</P>

</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Financing Activities
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net
	cash provided by financing activities totaled $213.4&nbsp;million for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, compared to cash used in financing
	activities of $57.6&nbsp;million for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015. The increase in cash provided by financing activities is primarily due to the Company's $275&nbsp;million borrowing
	(net of repayment) under its revolving credit facility to fund stream acquisitions during the current period. Refer to Item&nbsp;1, Business, Fiscal 2016 Business Developments, for further
	discussion on our recently acquired streams.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net
	cash used in financing activities totaled $57.6&nbsp;million for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015, compared to cash provided by financing activities of
	$66.9&nbsp;million for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2014. The decrease was the result of a purchase of an additional royalty interest from a non-controlling interest of approximately
	$11.5&nbsp;million during fiscal year 2014. This decrease was partially offset by an
	increase in the common stock dividend payment, which was the result of an increase in the dividend rate when compared to fiscal year 2014.
</FONT>
</P>

	Amounts
	represent principal ($370&nbsp;million) and estimated interest payments ($31.9&nbsp;million) assuming no early extinguishment.

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	information on our contractual obligations, see Note&nbsp;6 of the notes to consolidated financial statements under Part&nbsp;II, Item&nbsp;8, "Financial Statements and
	Supplementary Data" of this report. The above table does not include stream or royalty commitments as discussed in Note&nbsp;15 of the notes to consolidated financial statements. The Company
	believes it will be able to fund all existing obligations from net cash provided by operating activities.
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>

	Off-Balance Sheet Arrangements

	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We do not have any off-balance sheet arrangements that have or are reasonably likely to have a current or future effect on our
	financial condition, changes in financial condition, revenues or expenses, results of operations, liquidity, capital expenditures or capital resources that are material to investors.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL>
<EFX_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS>
<A NAME="FIS_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Results of Operations
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Fiscal Year Ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, Compared with Fiscal Year Ended June&nbsp;30, 2015
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, we recorded a net loss available to Royal Gold common stockholders of
	$77.1&nbsp;million, or ($1.18) per basic share and diluted share, compared to net income available to Royal Gold common stockholders of $52.0&nbsp;million, or $0.80 per basic share and diluted
	share, for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015. The decrease in our earnings per share was primarily attributable to impairment charges of approximately $98.6&nbsp;million (including a
	royalty receivable write
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	46
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=48,EFW="2229433",CP="ROYAL GOLD, INC",DN="1",CHK=800587,FOLIO='46',FILE='DISK127:[16ZBQ1.16ZBQ74901]DQ74901A.;13',USER='CMATTI',CD=';9-AUG-2016;17:44' -->
<A NAME="A2229433Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DQ74901_1_47">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229433Z10-K_HTM_BG74901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	down
	of approximately $2.9&nbsp;million) on our stream interest at the Phoenix Gold Project and certain other non-principal royalty interests during our quarter ended March&nbsp;31, 2016, as
	discussed further below. The decrease in our earnings per share was also attributable to an increase in tax expense of approximately $56.0&nbsp;million due to the Company's termination of the
	Andacollo royalty interest, as discussed below, and the planned liquidation of our Chilean subsidiary during the quarter ended September&nbsp;30, 2015. These decreases were partially offset by an
	increase in our revenue, which is also discussed below. The effect of the impairment charges during our fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, was $1.33 per basic share, after taxes, while the effect
	of the tax expense attributable to the termination of the Andacollo royalty interest during the current period, was $0.86 per basic share. During the prior year period, our earnings per share were
	negatively impacted by impairment charges of approximately $31.3&nbsp;million (including a royalty receivable write down of $3.0&nbsp;million) on certain non-principal royalty interests. The
	effect of the impairment charges during the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015, was $0.37 per basic share, after taxes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, we recognized total revenue of $359.8&nbsp;million, which is comprised of stream revenue of $238.0&nbsp;million and royalty revenue of
	$121.8&nbsp;million, at an average gold price of $1,168 per ounce, an average silver price of $15.32 per ounce and an average copper price of $2.22 per pound, compared to total revenue of
	$278.0&nbsp;million, which is comprised of stream revenue of $94.1&nbsp;million and royalty revenue of $183.9&nbsp;million, at an average gold price of $1,224 per ounce, an average silver price
	of $17.36 per ounce and an average copper price of $2.89 per pound, for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015. Revenue and the corresponding production, attributable to our stream and
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	47

<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(1)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Reported
	production relates to the amount of metal sales, subject to our stream and royalty interests, for the twelve months ended
	June&nbsp;30, 2016 and 2015, and may differ from the operators' public reporting.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(2)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Refer
	to Item&nbsp;2, Properties, for further discussion on our principal stream interests. Our streams at Andacollo, Pueblo Viejo and Wassa
	and Prestea were acquired during the quarter ended September&nbsp;30, 2015. Refer to Item&nbsp;1, Business, Fiscal 2016 Business Developments, for further discussion on the recent stream
	acquisitions.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(3)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Royalty
	no longer considered principal to our business as of June&nbsp;30, 2016.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(4)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Refer
	to Item&nbsp;1, Business, Fiscal 2016 Business Developments, for further discussion on the recent Andacollo royalty sale.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	48
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=50,EFW="2229433",CP="ROYAL GOLD, INC",DN="1",CHK=225069,FOLIO='48',FILE='DISK127:[16ZBQ1.16ZBQ74901]DQ74901A.;13',USER='CMATTI',CD=';9-AUG-2016;17:44' -->
<A NAME="A2229433Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DQ74901_1_49">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229433Z10-K_HTM_BG74901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(5)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Individually,
	no stream or royalty included within the "Other" category contributed greater than 5% of our total revenue for either period.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	increase in our total revenue for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, compared with the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015, resulted primarily from an increase in our
	stream revenue, which was a result of increased production at Mount Milligan and new production from our recently acquired streams, Wassa and Prestea, Pueblo Viejo, and Andacollo. Gold and silver
	ounces purchased and sold during the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 and 2015, and gold and silver ounces in inventory as of June&nbsp;30, 2016 and 2015, for our streaming interests were as
	follows:
</FONT>
</P>

</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	royalty revenue decreased during the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, compared with the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015, due to decreases in the average metal prices,
	the recent sale of the Andacollo royalty, and production decreases at Pe&ntilde;asquito and Cortez. Refer to Part&nbsp;I, Item&nbsp;2, Properties, for discussion and any updates on our
	principal producing properties.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Cost
	of sales were approximately $71.0&nbsp;million for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, compared to $33.5&nbsp;million for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015. The
	increase is primarily attributable to an increase in production at Mount Milligan and new stream production at Andacollo, Pueblo Viejo, and Wassa and Prestea. Cost of sales is specific to our stream
	agreements and is the result of RGLD Gold's purchase of gold and silver for a cash payment. The cash payment for Mount Milligan is the lesser of $435 per ounce or the prevailing market price of gold
	when purchased, while the cash payment for our other streams is a set contractual percentage of the gold or silver spot price near the date of metal delivery.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;General
	and administrative expenses increased to $31.7&nbsp;million for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, from $24.9&nbsp;million for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30,
	2015. The increase during the current period was primarily due to an increase in non-cash stock based compensation of approximately $4.9&nbsp;million as a result of management's change in estimate
	for the number of performance shares that are expected to vest.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Depreciation,
	depletion and amortization expense increased to $141.1&nbsp;million for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, from $93.5&nbsp;million for the fiscal year ended
	June&nbsp;30, 2015. The increase was primarily attributable to the ramp-up in production at Mount Milligan ($11.4&nbsp;million) and new production from the recently acquired streams at Pueblo
	Viejo ($21.9&nbsp;million), Wassa and Prestea ($7.8&nbsp;million) and Andacollo ($9.0&nbsp;million).
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	49
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=51,EFW="2229433",CP="ROYAL GOLD, INC",DN="1",CHK=574310,FOLIO='49',FILE='DISK127:[16ZBQ1.16ZBQ74901]DQ74901A.;13',USER='CMATTI',CD=';9-AUG-2016;17:44' -->
<A NAME="A2229433Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DQ74901_1_50">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229433Z10-K_HTM_BG74901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Exploration
	costs increased to $8.6&nbsp;million for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, from $2.2&nbsp;million for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015. Exploration
	costs are specific to our Peak Gold joint venture for exploration and advancement of the Tetlin gold project, as discussed further in Note&nbsp;3 of the notes to consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Impairment
	of stream and royalty interests and royalty receivables was $98.6&nbsp;million for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 compared to $31.3&nbsp;million for the fiscal
	year end June&nbsp;30, 2015. The impairment of stream and royalty interests ($96.1&nbsp;million) was the result of our regular impairment analysis conducted during the quarter ended
	March&nbsp;31, 2016, and was primarily due to the presence of impairment indicators on our stream interest at the Phoenix Gold Project and two non-principal producing royalty interests, Inata and
	Wolverine. Also during the current fiscal year, the Company recognized an allowance of approximately $2.9&nbsp;million on the entire outstanding royalty receivable associated with the Inata
	interest. The Company will continue to pursue collection efforts of all past due payments. Refer to Note&nbsp;4 of our notes to consolidated financial statements for further discussion on the
	impairments recognized during fiscal year 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
	the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, we recognized income tax expense totaling $60.7&nbsp;million compared with $9.6&nbsp;million during the fiscal year ended
	June&nbsp;30, 2015. This resulted in an effective tax rate of (278.9%) during the current period, compared with 15.4% in the prior period. The increase in the effective tax rate for the year ending
	June&nbsp;30, 2016 is primarily related to the impacts attributable to the Company's Andacollo transactions, the liquidation of our Chilean subsidiary, and impairment charges during the current
	fiscal year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Fiscal Year Ended June&nbsp;30, 2015, Compared with Fiscal Year Ended June&nbsp;30, 2014
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015, we recorded net income available to Royal Gold common stockholders of
	$52.0&nbsp;million, or $0.80 per basic share and diluted share, compared to net income available to Royal Gold common stockholders of $62.6&nbsp;million, or $0.96 per basic share and diluted
	share, for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2014. The decrease in our earnings per share was primarily attributable to impairment charges of approximately $31.3&nbsp;million (including a
	royalty receivable write down of $3.0&nbsp;million) on certain non-principal royalty interests during our quarter ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, as discussed further below. This decrease was
	partially offset by an increase in our revenue and a decrease in our income tax expense, which are also discussed below. The effect of the impairment charges on our fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30,
	2015, earnings per share was $0.37 per basic share, after taxes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015, we recognized total revenue of $278.0&nbsp;million, at an average gold price of $1,224 per ounce, an average silver price of $17.36 per
	ounce, an average copper price of $2.89 per pound and an average nickel price of $7.02 per pound, compared to total revenue of $237.2&nbsp;million, at an average gold price of $1,296 per ounce, an
	average silver price of $20.57 per ounce, an average nickel price of $6.89 per pound and an average copper price of $3.18 per pound, for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2014. Revenue and the
	corresponding production, attributable to our
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	50
</FONT>
</P>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-LEFT:20PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Total stream revenue
</I>
</B>

</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(1)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Reported
	production relates to the amount of metal sales, subject to our stream and royalty interests, for the twelve months ended
	June&nbsp;30, 2015 and 2014, as reported to us by the operators of the mines, and may differ from the operators' public reporting.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(2)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Individually,
	no royalty included within the "Other" category contributed greater than 5% of our total revenue for either period.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	increase in our total revenue for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015, compared with the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2014, resulted primarily from an increase in our
	stream revenue, which was a result of increased production at Mount Milligan. Gold ounces purchased and sold during the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015 and 2014, and gold ounces in inventory as
	of June&nbsp;30, 2015 and 2014, for our streaming interests were as follows:
</FONT>
</P>

<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	N/A
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	51
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=53,EFW="2229433",CP="ROYAL GOLD, INC",DN="1",CHK=847989,FOLIO='51',FILE='DISK127:[16ZBQ1.16ZBQ74901]DQ74901A.;13',USER='CMATTI',CD=';9-AUG-2016;17:44' -->
<A NAME="A2229433Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DQ74901_1_52">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229433Z10-K_HTM_BG74901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	royalty revenue decreased during the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015, compared with the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2014, due to decreases in the average gold, silver
	and copper prices and due to production decreases primarily at Andacollo and Voisey's Bay. These decreases were partially offset by increased production at Cortez. Refer to Part&nbsp;I,
	Item&nbsp;2, Properties, for discussion and any updates on our principal producing properties.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Cost
	of sales were approximately $33.5&nbsp;million for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015, compared to $9.2&nbsp;million for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2014. The
	increase is attributable to an increase in production at Mount Milligan. During fiscal 2015, cost of sales was specific to our stream agreement for Mount Milligan and is the result of the Company's
	purchases of gold for a cash payment of the lesser of $435 per ounce, or the prevailing market price of gold when purchased.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;General
	and administrative expenses increased to $24.9&nbsp;million for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015, from $21.2&nbsp;million for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30,
	2014. The increase was primarily due an increase in non-cash stock based compensation expense of approximately $2.6&nbsp;million as a result of management's change in estimate for the number of
	performance shares that are expected to vest.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Depreciation,
	depletion and amortization expense increased to $93.5&nbsp;million for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015, from $91.3&nbsp;million for the fiscal year ended
	June&nbsp;30, 2014. The increase was primarily attributable to the ramp-up in production at Mount Milligan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Impairment
	of stream and royalty interests was $31.3&nbsp;million for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015. The impairment charges were the result of our regular impairment
	analysis and were primarily due to the presence of impairment indicators on a non-principal producing royalty interest, Wolverine, during the three months ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The Company
	also determined during the three months ended September&nbsp;30, 2014, that a non-principal production stage royalty interest and one exploration stage royalty interest should be written down to
	zero for an impairment charge of $1.8&nbsp;million. Refer to Note&nbsp;4 of our notes to consolidated financial statements for further discussion on the impairments recognized during fiscal year
	2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
	the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015, we recognized income tax expense totaling $9.6&nbsp;million compared with $19.5&nbsp;million during the fiscal year ended
	June&nbsp;30, 2014. This resulted in an effective tax rate of 15.4% during fiscal year 2015, compared with 23.5% during fiscal year 2014. The decrease in the effective tax rate for the fiscal year
	ended June&nbsp;30, 2015, is primarily attributable to (i)&nbsp;a decrease in tax expense relating to a decrease in unrealized taxable foreign currency exchange gains, (ii)&nbsp;a favorable tax
	rate associated with certain operations in lower-tax jurisdictions, (iii)&nbsp;a valuation allowance release as a result of the strengthening U.S. dollar, (iv)&nbsp;a decrease in tax expense due
	to the Chilean tax legislation enacted in the quarter ended September&nbsp;30, 2014, and the corresponding re-measurement of the Chilean long term deferred tax asset to the higher corporate income
	tax rate, and (v)&nbsp;the impairment charge on the Wolverine royalty interest and the corresponding tax benefit recorded in the quarter ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, and (vi)&nbsp;net of the
	effect of an increase in tax expense due to Canadian tax legislation enacted in the quarter ended June&nbsp;30, 2015, which resulted in the re-measurement of Canadian deferred tax liabilities at the
	higher tax rate. Excluding the enactment of the Chilean tax legislation during the quarter ended September&nbsp;30, 2014, the impairment charge on the Wolverine royalty interest during the quarter
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, and the enactment of Canadian tax legislation during the quarter ended June&nbsp;30, 2015, the effective tax rate for the twelve months ended June&nbsp;30, 2015,
	would have been 19.6%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>

	projections or estimates contained herein. Such forward-looking statements include,

<!-- ZEQ.=9,SEQ=56,EFW="2229433",CP="ROYAL GOLD, INC",DN="1",CHK=66925,FOLIO='54',FILE='DISK127:[16ZBQ1.16ZBQ74901]DQ74901A.;13',USER='CMATTI',CD=';9-AUG-2016;17:44' -->
<A NAME="A2229433Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DQ74901_1_55">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229433Z10-K_HTM_BG74901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS>
</EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<EFX_MARKET_RISK>
<A NAME="FIS_MARKET_RISK"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2229433Z10-K_HTM_DQ74901_ITEM_7A__QUANTITATIVE_AND_QUAL__ITE02619">
</A>
<A NAME="A2229433Z10-K_HTM_TOC_DQ74901_3">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	ITEM 7A.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;QUANTITATIVE AND QUALITATIVE DISCLOSURE ABOUT MARKET RISK
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our earnings and cash flows are significantly impacted by changes in the market price of gold and other metals. Gold, silver, copper,
	nickel and other metal prices can fluctuate significantly and are affected by numerous factors, such as demand, production levels, economic policies of central banks, producer hedging, world political
	and economic events and the strength of the U.S. dollar relative to other currencies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
	the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, we reported revenue of $359.8&nbsp;million, with an average gold price for the period of $1,168 per ounce, an average silver price
	for the period of $15.32 per ounce and an average copper price of $2.22 per pound. Approximately 88% of our total recognized revenues for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 were attributable
	to gold sales from our gold producing interests, as shown within the MD&amp;A. For the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, if the price of gold had averaged 10% higher or lower per ounce, we would
	have recorded an increase or decrease in revenue of approximately $33&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Approximately
	3% of our total reported revenue for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 was attributable to silver sales from our silver producing interests. For the fiscal year
	ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, if the price of silver had averaged 10% higher or lower per ounce, we would have recorded an increase or decrease in revenues of approximately $1.1&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Approximately
	4% of our total reported revenue for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 was attributable to copper sales from our copper producing interests. For the fiscal year
	ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, if the price of copper had averaged 10% higher or lower per pound, we would have recorded an increase or decrease in revenues of approximately $1.9&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	55
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=10,SEQ=57,EFW="2229433",CP="ROYAL GOLD, INC",DN="1",CHK=301965,FOLIO='55',FILE='DISK127:[16ZBQ1.16ZBQ74901]DQ74901A.;13',USER='CMATTI',CD=';9-AUG-2016;17:44' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2229433Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FA74901_1_56">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLESHADECOLOR,"#CCEEFF" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_STABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_SCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- TOC_END -->

<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION"></A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2229433Z10-K_HTM_FC74901_REPORT_OF_INDEPENDENT___FC702285">
</A>
<A NAME="A2229433Z10-K_HTM_TOC_FC74901_1">
</A>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	REPORT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	Board of Directors and Shareholders of Royal Gold,&nbsp;Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	have audited the accompanying consolidated balance sheets of Royal Gold,&nbsp;Inc. as of June&nbsp;30, 2016 and 2015, and the related consolidated statements of operations and
	comprehensive (loss) income, changes in equity and cash flows for each of the three years in the period ended June&nbsp;30, 2016. These financial statements are the responsibility of the Company's
	management. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on these financial statements based on our audits.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	conducted our audits in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States). Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to
	obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements are free of material misstatement. An audit includes examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and disclosures in
	the financial statements. An audit also includes assessing the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by management, as well as evaluating the overall financial statement
	presentation. We believe that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	our opinion, the financial statements referred to above present fairly, in all material respects, the consolidated financial position of Royal Gold,&nbsp;Inc. at June&nbsp;30,
	2016 and 2015, and the consolidated results of its operations and its cash flows for each of the three years in the period ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, in conformity with U.S. generally accepted
	accounting principles.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	also have audited, in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States), Royal Gold&nbsp;Inc.'s internal control over financial
	reporting as of June&nbsp;30, 2016, based on criteria established in Internal Control&#151;Integrated Framework issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission
	(2013 framework) and our report dated August&nbsp;11, 2016 expressed an unqualified opinion thereon.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	/s/
	Ernst&nbsp;&amp; Young&nbsp;LLP
<BR>
	Denver, Colorado
<BR>
	August&nbsp;11, 2016
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	57
</FONT>
</P>

	Table of Contents
</A>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2229433Z10-K_HTM_FM74901_ROYAL_GOLD,_INC__NOTES__FM702336">
</A>
<A NAME="A2229433Z10-K_HTM_TOC_FM74901_1">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	ROYAL GOLD,&nbsp;INC.
<BR>
<EFX_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT>
<A NAME="FIS_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT"></A>
<BR>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	1. THE COMPANY
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Royal Gold,&nbsp;Inc. ("Royal Gold", the "Company", "we", "us", or "our"), together with its subsidiaries, is engaged in the business of acquiring and managing precious metals
	royalties, metal streams, and similar interests. Royalties are non-operating interests in mining projects that provide the right to revenue or metals produced from the project after deducting
	specified costs, if any. A metal stream is a purchase agreement that provides, in exchange for an upfront deposit payment, the right to purchase all or a portion of one or more metals produced from a
	mine, at a price determined for the life of the transaction by the purchase agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	2. SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES AND RECENTLY ADOPTED AND ISSUED ACCOUNTING PRONOUNCEMENTS
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Summary of Significant Accounting Policies
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Use of Estimates
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The preparation of our financial statements in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America
	requires the Company to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities, and disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the dates of the financial
	statements, and the reported amounts of revenues and expenses during the reporting periods. Actual results could differ significantly from those estimates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	most critical accounting estimates relate to our assumptions regarding future gold, silver, copper, nickel and other metal prices and the estimates of reserves, production and
	recoveries of third-party mine operators. We rely on reserve estimates reported by the operators on the properties in which we have stream and royalty interests. These estimates and the underlying
	assumptions affect the potential impairments of long-lived assets and the ability to realize income tax benefits associated with deferred tax assets. These estimates and assumptions also affect the
	rate at which we recognize revenue or
	charge depreciation, depletion and amortization to earnings. On an ongoing basis, management evaluates these estimates and assumptions; however, actual amounts could differ from these estimates and
	assumptions. Differences between estimates and actual amounts could differ significantly and are recorded in the period that the actual amounts are known.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Basis of Consolidation
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The consolidated financial statements include the accounts of Royal Gold,&nbsp;Inc., its wholly-owned subsidiaries and an entity over
	which control is achieved through means other than voting right (see Note&nbsp;3). The Company follows the Accounting Standards Codification ("ASC") guidance for identification and reporting for
	entities over which control is achieved through means other than voting rights. All intercompany accounts, transactions, income and expenses, and profits or losses have been eliminated on
	consolidation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Cash and Equivalents
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Cash and equivalents consist of all cash balances and highly liquid investments with an original maturity of three months or less. Cash
	and equivalents were primarily held in cash deposit accounts as of June&nbsp;30, 2016 and 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	62
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=64,EFW="2229433",CP="ROYAL GOLD, INC",DN="1",CHK=76932,FOLIO='62',FILE='DISK127:[16ZBQ1.16ZBQ74901]FM74901A.;7',USER='CMATTI',CD=';9-AUG-2016;17:37' -->
<A NAME="A2229433Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FM74901_1_63">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229433Z10-K_HTM_BG74901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	ROYAL GOLD,&nbsp;INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	2. SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES AND RECENTLY ADOPTED AND ISSUED ACCOUNTING PRONOUNCEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Stream and Royalty Interests
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Stream and royalty interests include acquired stream and royalty interests in production, development and exploration stage properties.
	The costs of acquired stream and royalty interests are capitalized as tangible assets as such interests do not meet the definition of a financial asset under the Accounting Standards Codification
	("ASC") guidance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Acquisition
	costs of production stage stream and royalty interests are depleted using the units of production method over the life of the mineral property (as sales occur under stream
	interests or royalty payments are recognized), which are estimated using proven and probable reserves as provided by the operator. Acquisition costs of stream and royalty interests on development
	stage mineral properties, which are not yet in production, are not amortized until the property begins production. Acquisition costs of stream or royalty interests on exploration stage mineral
	properties, where there are no proven and probable reserves, are not amortized. At such time as the associated exploration stage mineral interests are converted to proven and probable reserves, the
	cost basis is amortized over the remaining life of the mineral property, using proven and probable reserves. The carrying values of exploration stage mineral interests are evaluated for impairment at
	such time as information becomes available indicating that the production will not occur in the future. Exploration costs are expensed when incurred.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Available-for-Sale Securities
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Investments in securities that management does not have the intent to sell in the near term and that have readily determinable fair
	values are classified as available-for-sale securities. Unrealized gains and losses on these investments are recorded in accumulated other comprehensive (loss) income as a separate component of
	stockholders' equity, except that declines in market value judged to be other than temporary are recognized in determining net income. When investments are sold, the realized gains and losses on these
	investments, determined using the specific identification method, are included in determining net income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company's policy for determining whether declines in fair value of available-for-sale securities are other than temporary includes a quarterly analysis of the investments and a
	review by management of all investments for which the cost exceeds the fair value. Any temporary declines in fair value are recorded as a charge to other comprehensive (loss) income. This evaluation
	considers a number of factors including, but not limited to, the length of time and extent to which the fair value has been less than cost, the financial condition and near term prospects of the
	issuer, and management's ability and intent to hold the securities until fair value recovers. If such impairment is determined by the Company to be other-than-temporary, the investment's cost basis is
	written down to fair value and recorded in net income during the period the Company determines such impairment to be other-than-temporary. The new cost basis is not changed for subsequent recoveries
	in fair value. Refer to Note&nbsp;5 for further discussion on our available-for-sale securities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Asset Impairment
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We evaluate long-lived assets for impairment whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that the related carrying amounts of
	an asset or group of assets may not be recoverable. The recoverability of the carrying value of stream and royalty interests in production and development stage
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	63
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=65,EFW="2229433",CP="ROYAL GOLD, INC",DN="1",CHK=941022,FOLIO='63',FILE='DISK127:[16ZBQ1.16ZBQ74901]FM74901A.;7',USER='CMATTI',CD=';9-AUG-2016;17:37' -->
<A NAME="A2229433Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FM74901_1_64">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229433Z10-K_HTM_BG74901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	ROYAL GOLD,&nbsp;INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	2. SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES AND RECENTLY ADOPTED AND ISSUED ACCOUNTING PRONOUNCEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	mineral
	properties is evaluated based upon estimated future undiscounted net cash flows from each stream and royalty interest using estimates of proven and probable reserves and other relevant
	information received from the operators. We evaluate the recoverability of the carrying value of royalty interests in exploration stage mineral properties in the event of significant decreases in the
	price of gold, silver, copper, nickel and other metals, and whenever new information regarding the mineral properties is obtained from the operator indicating that production will not likely occur or
	may be reduced in the future, thus potentially affecting the future recoverability of our stream or royalty interests. Impairments in the carrying value of each property are measured and recorded to
	the extent that the carrying value in each property exceeds its estimated fair value, which is generally calculated using estimated future discounted cash flows.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Estimates
	of gold, silver, copper, nickel and other metal prices, operators' estimates of proven and probable reserves or mineralized material related to our stream or royalty
	properties, and operators' estimates of operating and capital costs are subject to certain risks and uncertainties which may affect the recoverability of our investment in these stream and royalty
	interests in mineral properties. It is possible that changes could occur to these estimates, which could adversely affect the net cash flows expected to be generated from these stream and royalty
	interests. Refer to Note&nbsp;4 for discussion and the results of our impairment assessments for the fiscal years ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 and 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Revenue
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Revenue is recognized pursuant to guidance in ASC 605 and based upon amounts contractually due pursuant to the underlying streaming or
	royalty agreement. Specifically, revenue is recognized in accordance with the terms of the underlying stream or royalty agreements subject to (i)&nbsp;the pervasive evidence of the existence of the
	arrangements; (ii)&nbsp;the risks and rewards
	having been transferred; (iii)&nbsp;the stream or royalty being fixed or determinable; and (iv)&nbsp;the collectability being reasonably assured. For our streaming agreements, we recognize revenue
	when the metal is sold.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Metal Sales
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Gold and silver received under our metal streaming agreements is taken into inventory, and this is sold primarily using average spot
	rate gold and silver forward contracts. The sales price for our gold and silver sold in average spot rate forward contracts is determined by the average daily gold or silver spot prices under the term
	of the contract, typically over a consecutive number of trading days between 10&nbsp;days and three months (depending on the frequency of deliveries under the respective streaming agreement and our
	sales policy in effect at the time) commencing shortly after receipt and purchase of the metal. Revenue from gold and silver sales is recognized on the date of the settlement, which is also the date
	that title to the gold or silver passes to the purchaser.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Cost of Sales
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Cost of sales is specific to our stream agreements and is the result of our purchase of gold and silver for a cash payment. The cash
	payment at Mount Milligan is the lesser of $435 per ounce or the prevailing market price of gold when purchased, while the cash payment for our other streams is a set contractual percentage of the
	gold or silver spot price near the date of metal delivery.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	64
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229433Z10-K_HTM_BG74901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	ROYAL GOLD,&nbsp;INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	2. SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES AND RECENTLY ADOPTED AND ISSUED ACCOUNTING PRONOUNCEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Production taxes
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Certain royalty payments are subject to production taxes (or mining proceeds taxes), which are recognized at the time of revenue
	recognition. Production taxes are not
	income taxes and are included within the costs and expenses section in the Company's consolidated statements of operations and comprehensive (loss) income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Exploration Costs
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Exploration costs are specific to the Peak Gold&nbsp;LLC ("Peak Gold") joint venture for exploration and advancement of the Tetlin
	gold project, as discussed further in Note&nbsp;3. Exploration costs associated with Peak Gold for the exploration and advancement of the Tetlin gold project are expensed when incurred.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Stock-Based Compensation
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company accounts for stock-based compensation in accordance with the guidance of ASC 718. The Company recognizes all share-based
	payments to employees, including grants of employee stock options, stock-settled stock appreciation rights ("SSARs"), restricted stock and performance shares, in its financial statements based upon
	their fair values.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_25"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Reportable Segments and Geographical Information
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company manages its business under two reportable segments, consisting of the acquisition and management of stream interests and
	the acquisition and management of royalty interests. Royal Gold's long-lived assets (stream and royalty interests, net) as of June&nbsp;30, 2016 and 2015 are geographically distributed as shown in
	the following table:
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:54%;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</FONT>
</P>
